r.d: Classes to calculate statistical parameters of numerical arrays of data. The data can be in a simple numerical array, or in a cummulative numerical array. A cummulative array, has the value as the index and the number of repeats as the value for the array item, e.g. $data = array(3=>4, 2.3=>5, 1.25=>6, 0.5=>3). Nulls can be rejected, ignored or handled as zero values.
r.n: Added methods sampleCentralMoment() and sampleRawMoment() to calculate the corresponding nth moments of the data set. Explicit casting of parameters passed to pow() to circumvent the warnings/errors given by some versions of the PHP interpreter. Thanks to Stephen Evans for pointing this problem out.
